Package org.neo4j.scheduler

Interface ExecutorServiceFactory

  • interface ExecutorServiceFactory
    Implementations of this interface are used by the JobHandle implementation to create the underlying ExecutorServices that actually run the scheduled jobs. The choice of implementation is decided by the scheduling Group, which can thereby influence how jobs in the particular group are executed.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  ExecutorServiceFactory.CallingThreadExecutorService
      An executor service which always executes the runnable on the calling thread.
      static class  ExecutorServiceFactory.DiscardingExecutorService  
      static class  ExecutorServiceFactory.ExecutorServiceAdapter  
      static class  ExecutorServiceFactory.ThrowingExecutorService
      An executor service which always throws a RejectedExecutionException on any task submission.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      ExecutorService build​(Group group, SchedulerThreadFactory factory, int threadCount)
      Create an ExecutorService, ideally with the desired thread count if possible.
      static ExecutorServiceFactory cached()
      Execute jobs in a dynamically growing pool of threads.
      static ExecutorServiceFactory cachedWithDiscard()
      Will execute at most thread-count jobs concurrently, and silently discard tasks when over-subscribed.
      static ExecutorServiceFactory callingThread()
      Executes all jobs on the calling thread.
      static ExecutorServiceFactory fixedWithBackPressure()
      Execute jobs in fixed size pool of threads and if job queue fills up, the caller executes the job and thereby applying back pressure.
      static ExecutorServiceFactory singleThread()
      Executes all jobs in the same single thread.
      static ExecutorServiceFactory unschedulable()
      This factory actually prevents the scheduling and execution of any jobs, which is useful for groups that are not meant to be scheduled directly.
      static ExecutorServiceFactory workStealing()
      Schedules jobs in a work-stealing (ForkJoin) thread pool.
      static ExecutorServiceFactory workStealingAsync()
      Schedules jobs in a work-stealing (ForkJoin) thread pool, configuring to be in an "asynchronous" mode, which is more suitable for event-processing.

    • Method Detail

      • build

        ExecutorService build​(Group group,
                      SchedulerThreadFactory factory,
                      int threadCount)
        Create an ExecutorService, ideally with the desired thread count if possible. Implementations are allowed to ignore the given thread count.
        Parameters:
        group - the group the executor service will handle.
        factory - the thread factory to use.
        threadCount - the desired thread count, 0 implies unlimited.

      • unschedulable

        static ExecutorServiceFactory unschedulable()
        This factory actually prevents the scheduling and execution of any jobs, which is useful for groups that are not meant to be scheduled directly.

      • singleThread

        static ExecutorServiceFactory singleThread()
        Executes all jobs in the same single thread.

      • callingThread

        static ExecutorServiceFactory callingThread()
        Executes all jobs on the calling thread.

      • cached

        static ExecutorServiceFactory cached()
        Execute jobs in a dynamically growing pool of threads. The threads will be cached and kept around for a little while to cope with work load spikes and troughs.

      • workStealing

        static ExecutorServiceFactory workStealing()
        Schedules jobs in a work-stealing (ForkJoin) thread pool. Parallel streams and ForkJoinTasks started from within the scheduled jobs will also run inside the same ForkJoinPool.

      • workStealingAsync

        static ExecutorServiceFactory workStealingAsync()
        Schedules jobs in a work-stealing (ForkJoin) thread pool, configuring to be in an "asynchronous" mode, which is more suitable for event-processing.

        You can read more about asynchronous mode in the ForkJoinPool documentation.

        Parallel streams and ForkJoinTasks started from within the scheduled jobs will also run inside the same ForkJoinPool.

      • fixedWithBackPressure

        static ExecutorServiceFactory fixedWithBackPressure()
        Execute jobs in fixed size pool of threads and if job queue fills up, the caller executes the job and thereby applying back pressure.

      • cachedWithDiscard

        static ExecutorServiceFactory cachedWithDiscard()
        Will execute at most thread-count jobs concurrently, and silently discard tasks when over-subscribed. Tasks are not queued, but either stared immediately or discarded. Threads are cached for one minute and reused when possible.
